reviews.text:
A very rude woman was at the counter when we tried to leave on an earlier train due to my afternoon activities being cancelled. We were told we would have to pay full price for new tickets and she even had the nerve to ignore my discount card in order to make me pay more.

The station was quiet however which was nice

Nice station which has handy tram and bus links.  As far as I'm aware all Edinburgh - Glasgow services stop here so you don't need to go right to Waverly to catch a train to Glasgow.  There is a cafe inside the station with plenty of shops in the area.  Unsure if there is parking facilities available.

I had been to Edinburgh  for a lovely day out with my husband and daughter . I got on the 16.12  going to lockerbie from the Waverly station the train was so packed , I couldnt move I  panicked and got off at haymarket, leaving my family on the train . I was quite distressed and was helped by two lovely ladies Laura and Sam . I had to wait for two hours on another train but was i was well looked after thank you ladies x
Brilliant station for photography and staff brilliant

My train was due at 11:49, Iturned up 10 minutes early to make sure that I was on time and cut my night out with some friends short.

The train turned up at the wrong storm, causing more than 25 ppl to run up one set of stairs and down another only for the doors to shut and the train to leave before anyone made it in time. Terrible service and severely disappointed that Scotrail didn't even bother to update what platform the train was due to arrive at. Shocking service! And made me and 20+ other ppl have to wait nearly an hour for the next one
